dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, guys, big news out of Kazakhstan regarding their nuclear ambitions. It's pretty interesting, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, guys, big news out of Kazakhstan regarding their nuclear ambitions. It's pretty interesting, actually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! I saw something about their *second* nuclear power plant potentially being built faster than the first? That, like, kinda blew my mind.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! I saw something about their second nuclear power plant potentially being built faster than the first? That, like, kinda blew my mind.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: First Deputy Prime Minister Roman Sklyar has addressed the possibility that Kazakhstan™s second nuclear power plant (NPP) could be built faster than the first.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? I mean, Roman Sklyar, the First Deputy PM, he actually addressed that. He said it all kinda hinges on the tech.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? I mean, Roman Sklyar, the First Deputy P M, he actually addressed that. He said it all kinda hinges on the tech.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Sklyar, the construction timeline will depend largely on the technology proposed by the company implementing the project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The tech? [overlapping] So, like, what the company proposes?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The tech? So, like, what the company proposes?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! What the company building it proposes. That's, um, what will determine the construction timeline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! What the company building it proposes. That's, um, what will determine the construction timeline.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Everything will depend on the technology provided by the company building it, Sklyar said in response to questions from journalists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, the tech makes all the difference, huh? And they're not even planning to delay the second one. They wanna build both in parallel, which is, um, really ambitious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, the tech makes all the difference, huh? And they're not even planning to delay the second one. They wanna build both in parallel, which is, um, really ambitious.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also emphasized that the government does not plan to delay the construction of the second nuclear facility and intends to develop both projects in parallel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But then, uh, the cost? That's still a big question mark, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But then, uh, the cost? That's still a big question mark, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As for the cost of the future station, that question remains open.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no, I saw that. They won't know the total till after the feasibility study is done. Which, you know, makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no, I saw that. They won't know the total till after the feasibility study is done. Which, you know, makes sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The total will be known only after the completion of a feasibility study.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. But, um, speaking of specifics, I also saw something about staff training? That's pretty crucial.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. But, um, speaking of specifics, I also saw something about staff training? That's pretty crucial.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely! Almassadam Satkaliyev, the head of their Atomic Energy Agency, he'd previously mentioned that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely! Almassadam Satkaliyev, the head of their Atomic Energy Agency, he'd previously mentioned that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sklyar also reminded the public that Almassadam Satkaliyev, head of the Atomic Energy Agency, had previously mentioned staff training for the nuclear sector.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're training Kazakhstani specialists. Not just to work at the plants, but also for scientific research in the field.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they're training Kazakhstani specialists. Not just to work at the plants, but also for scientific research in the field.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstani specialists will be trained to work at the plant and engage in scientific research in the field.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is super important, right? You can't just build these massive facilities without the skilled people to run them safely. That's good forward-thinking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is super important, right? You can't just build these massive facilities without the skilled people to run them safely. That's good forward-thinking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And, uh, speaking of the first NPP, Russia's Rosatom was actually selected as the lead for that one, heading up an international consortium.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And, uh, speaking of the first N P P, Russia's Rosatom was actually selected as the lead for that one, heading up an international consortium.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, Kazakhstan™s Atomic Energy Agency announced that Russia™s Rosatom was selected as the lead of an international consortium for the construction of the first NPP in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and I think it's important to note that Kazakhstan will be the sole owner of that first plant, too. That's a pretty big deal, ownership-wise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and I think it's important to note that Kazakhstan will be the sole owner of that first plant, too. That's a pretty big deal, ownership-wise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan will become the sole owner of its first nuclear power plant

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. So, uh, all very dynamic stuff happening in their energy sector. It'll be interesting to see how these parallel projects actually, like, unfold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. So, uh, all very dynamic stuff happening in their energy sector. It'll be interesting to see how these parallel projects actually, like, unfold.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Lots to keep an eye on, especially with those timelines.
